p: Mastic essential oil is a volatile mixture, produced both through traditionally used methods, such as water or steam distillation, or by newly established methodologies, such as supercritical fluid extraction (SFE) [ 10, 11]. The oil is mainly comprised of chemicals categorized as oxygenated monoterpenes, monoterpene hydrocarbons, or sesquiterpenes, which represent approximately 20%, 50%, and 25% of the mastic essential oil, respectively [ 10, 12, 13]. Its main constituents are Î±-pinene, myrcene, linalool, and camphene [ 14].
